text.text_translated:
A civilisation is when many people live together. They have rules and make things like art.
From 100,000 to 50,000 years before now, we find signs of early human civilisation. For example, we see paintings on rock walls. No one knows the link between this and language. Brains did not get bigger fast. But people got smarter. Did language make their brains grow? Or did their smart brains begin to make language?
